column4: Does anyone know if there is any ubuntu packages for a mencoder gui? I used kmenc15 and some other gtk gui in the past, but i cannot find a single package that works on edgy :(
bleh.. asked three times and not a single reply to my question :(
Does anyone know if there is any ubuntu packages for a mencoder gui? I used kmenc15 and some other gtk gui in the past, but i cannot find a single package that works on edgy :(
Am i really the only one who encodes videos?
apt-cache search mencoder
i find no gui..
not sure, never used a gui for that
thanks for responding atleast.. :)
you need a video editor actually and not a gui to mencoder, if i got that right
try kino
basically what i need is a program to encode mpeg2 into mpeg4 like xvid or similar. I also need to cut away the top and bottom of the picture
acidrip
dosent that only support dvds?
not sure, never tried without dvds
i looked around in it and found no way to open a mpeg2 file
i remember a package, i think it was dvd:rip
though not sure bout the name, its been a while
i usually used ^scripts^ for dvd to vcd, svcd, mvcd and xvid, mkv and ogm
and then again, i got a weird hunch, how about using vlc to stream an mpg2 to a stdout and take that stdout through mencoder?
the problem is that i need to cut away the logo and such
well, for the cutting thats where i mentoined kino
i could be wrong, but i remember mencoder as "encoder" which isnt exactly a cutter
many different formats/codecs :\
